definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
ancient ceramic three-legged vessel used for cooking with cord markings on the outside and hollow legs
(dialect) to die/to give up the ghost
erhua variant of 打嗝[da3 ge2]

sentences.english: He hiccupped for 69 years and 5 months.
sentences.chinese: 他打了69年零五個月的嗝。

sentences.english: Garland covered his mouth with his hand and belched discreetly.
sentences.chinese: 加蘭用手掩住嘴巴，小心地打了一個嗝。

sentences.english: Early Thursday morning, Jennifer said she hiccuped just one more time.
sentences.chinese: 星期四清晨，珍妮佛說她只又打了一次嗝。

sentences.english: In either case, burping a few times after eating is normal.
sentences.chinese: 無論是上述的哪種情況，飯後打幾個嗝都是正常的。

sentences.english: After pat hold up, I heard the sound of your baby's belch out the air on schedule.
sentences.chinese: 喫完抱起來拍一拍，聽到寶寶的嗝聲空氣就排出來了。

sentences.english: Do not cross this, his cerebral haemorrhage breaks out , belch fart.
sentences.chinese: 不過這回，他腦溢血發作，嗝屁了。

sentences.english: Just one hiccup could destroy a carving in progress.
sentences.chinese: 在雕刻中打個嗝可能都會讓你功虧一簣。

definition: erhua variant of 打嗝[da3 ge2]
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
(onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
